Ad Text:
The Client 
Our client is a highly regarded Federal Government agency. Thay are Australia’s independent corporate, markets, financial services, and consumer credit regulator. They enforce laws to protect consumers and investors, overseeing company conduct, financial advice, insurance, and superannuation. 

The Role 
The Business Analyst must be able to use a variety of business analysis techniques including agile to deliver high quality outputs for the project and within project timelines. Business Analysts must work closely with business Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) and senior staff, guide other Business Analysts to identify, analyse and document business objectives for a business unit or cluster, and conduct complex analysis to articulate the business requirements in order to meet those objectives.
 
You will be required to:

Work with the business SME’s and IT teams to analyse business requirements to discover the underlying business need to be addressed, through workshops or discussions with stakeholders.
Specifying Requirements (business, functional and non-functional) – documenting the requirements in a format that can be shared with, and easily understood by, a variety of stakeholders (Business, Executive, Application and Solution Designer resources, Development resources and Testing resources). This could be either traditional business requirements documents or User stories for Agile projects.
Develop user interface designs utilising User Central Design (UCD) principles and practices to design user interfaces that conform with industry and Australian Government Accessibility and Usability principles, practices, and guidelines.
Develop process maps with as-is process analysis and to-be process designs.
Learn and understand overall business structure, strategy and how it may impact on work efforts for the team.
Assist with testing preparation and execution.
Assist with UAT preparation and system implementation including the development of user manuals and training.
Displaying strong skills in managing your own performance to deliver strategic priorities and team business plans.
 
What's on offer

12 months with 12 months extension options
Work on a high‑priority federal program within a secure national agency
Hybrid working environment 

Security Clearance Requirement:
Due to the nature of this role, this job is open to Australian Citizens only and who hold a Baseline/NV1/NV2 security clearance (or higher) are encourgaged to apply.

Location:
This role can be located in Melbourne, VIC or Sydney, NSW

Contract Length:
Initial 12 months with 12 months extension option

Next Steps:
To apply, please click the Apply button on this page. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion on your suitability for this position, please contact Vanessa Parker on vanessa.parker@calleo.com.au

Calleo is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage applications from all people including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.
  
Follow Calleo on LinkedIn and visit our website to keep up to date on all our current job vacancies:
www.linkedin.com/company/calleoresourcing
www.calleo.com.au

 #SCR-vanessa-parker-1

We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst on a 12-month fixed term contract to support the definition, build, and implementation of a business-critical application within the general insurance industry. Reporting to the Head of PMO, this role will work closely with business stakeholders, technical teams, and delivery partners to ensure the solution meets business needs and is successfully implemented. This role is suited to a BA with hands-on experience delivering general insurance projects, who understands insurance operations and can translate business requirements into effective system solutions.

Key Responsibilities

Elicit, analyse, and document business, functional, and non-functional requirements within a general insurance context

Work closely with technical teams and vendors to translate business requirements into solution design and system configuration inputs

Analyse existing insurance processes, policies, and data flows, supporting the definition of future-state processes and identifying impacts

Support build, testing, and defect resolution activities, validating that solutions meet agreed requirements

Assist with data migration activities, including data mapping, validation, and reconciliation

Support business readiness, user validation, and Go-Live activities, ensuring the solution is fit for purpose

Contribute to change and communication activities, helping stakeholders understand impacts and adopt new ways of working

What You’ll Bring

Proven experience as a Business Analyst delivering projects within the general insurance industry (essential)

Experience supporting new software builds, system implementations, and/or data migration initiatives

Strong ability to work effectively with business stakeholders, technical teams, and delivery partners

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with high attention to detail

Experience using analytical and reporting tools, such as Power BI, to interpret and validate data (desirable)

Clear, confident written and verbal communication skills

At WTW, we believe that a culture of inclusion and diversity is critical to our business. It's not a separate initiative – rather it’s fundamental to everything we do. We are an equal-opportunity employer who is committed to fostering an inclusive work environment and embrace diversity including gender, nationality, disability, age, marital/parental status, ethnicity, gender identity and sexual orientation. We welcome applications from people from all backgrounds.

We’re committed to equal employment opportunity and provide application, interview and workplace adjustments and accommodations to all applicants. If you foresee any barriers, from the application process through to joining WTW, please email candidate.helpdesk@willistowerswatson.com

About Us

Canon is a global leader in imaging solutions, trusted by millions for innovation and quality. In Australia and New Zealand, we're proud to deliver products and services that help people connect, communicate, and achieve more every day. When you join Canon Australia you'll experience a supportive culture that values your contribution and empowers you to grow. We're committed to helping you develop your career and turn your goals into reality, while playing an integral role in our success across the region




Shape reward strategy, Influence leaders, Drive data‑led decisions
Join a highly collaborative team who value autonomy and flexibility
Macquarie Park Office with Flexible Hybrid working

About the Role

At Canon, our people strategy is built on insight, fairness and commercial impact. We're looking for an experienced Remuneration & Analytics Specialist to play a pivotal role in designing and delivering remuneration, incentive and analytics solutions that support our strategic goals across Canon Group Oceania.

You'll be the subject matter expert across remuneration, incentives, benefits and HR analytics. Acting as a trusted advisor, you'll bring together commercial modelling, governance, compliance and insights to support Canon's attraction, engagement and performance outcomes. You'll play a key role in the annual remuneration and incentive processes. You'll oversee superannuation governance, manage key regulatory reporting (including WGEA), and continually evolve our analytics capability to enable better decision making.

This is a highly visible role where you'll partner closely with HR, Finance and senior leaders to make a valuable contribution to the HR leadership team.

The scope of the role includes:

Lead the group‑wide remuneration review process, including commercial modelling, delivery on time and within budget
Manage annual incentive calculations and the preparation and distribution of senior leader letters
Design, review and evolve remuneration, incentive and benefits programs
Own superannuation governance, including policy management, provider relationships and committee coordination
Manage headcount governance, including weekly requests and quarterly executive reporting
Develop and enhance HR analytics dashboards and reporting in PowerBI, including performance trends and insights
Collate and manage data for WGEA reporting, tracking progress against targets
Maintain and refresh the Remuneration Governance Plan, including allowances and compliance data
Maintain SAP reporting libraries and deliver regular reporting aligned to group requirements
Proactively manage the HR P&L, tracking expenditure, reporting variances and identifying efficiency opportunities
Research market data and provide benchmarking insights and recommendations
Partner with external consultants (e.g. Mercer, Aon) to stay ahead of remuneration trends
Provide expert advice to leaders on salary, incentives, benefits and superannuation
Drive continuous improvement of remuneration processes, systems and controls
Support audits and ensure ongoing regulatory and policy compliance
Identify and oversee SAP remuneration module enhancements and upgrades

About you

You bring experience from either a remuneration and benefits or finance background, with a strong track record of managing remuneration programs, incentive frameworks and budgets in complex organisations. You're commercially focused and comfortable working in environments where accuracy, governance and financial discipline are critical.

Your key strength is your ability to analyse data and turn it into clear, actionable insights. You enjoy working with complex data sets, building models, identifying trends and providing evidence based recommendations that support senior leaders to make informed decisions. You're technically capable, with advanced Excel skills and experience using tools such as SAP and PowerBI to deliver accurate, meaningful reporting.

You have a sound understanding of remuneration and incentive design, market benchmarking and the Australian regulatory landscape, including superannuation requirements. You communicate with confidence, build strong relationships across HR, Finance and the business, and are valued for your ability to translate data into practical, commercial advice. Experience with HR systems, payroll or project delivery will be well regarded.

What's in it for you

This is a high impact role where your insights directly influence senior leaders and business outcomes. You'll enjoy autonomy, flexibility and the opportunity to shape how Canon rewards and engages its people, supported by a collaborative and inclusive culture.

Benefits include:

Additional leave benefits
A collaborative, supportive team environment
Hybrid working (2 WFH days per week)
Attractive product discounts
Free on-site parking and gym

We believe in the power of an inclusive and diverse workforce. We trust you will bring your authentic self to work and we will focus on making sure that together, we make a strong contribution to the broader community in which we operate. Where possible, flexible working arrangements are the norm, as we know a better work-life balance can improve your motivation, performance, and productivity.

As an equal opportunity employer focused on strengthening our inclusive culture, all applicants will be considered and we welcome applications from people of all ages, cultures including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, abilities, religious beliefs, national origin, sexual orientation and gender identities. Benefits/perks may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Canon Group and the country where you work. All applicants must be eligible to work in the country they are applying to at the time of application.

Looking to join this diverse team? Apply online now.

Successful applicants will be notified of next steps

Your Impact

 

This is a newly created opportunity to play a central role in shaping enterprise strategy within one of Australia’s leading consumer organisations. Reporting to the Head of Strategy, you will lead high-value strategic initiatives that directly influence long-term business direction across Oceania.

 

Joining at a pivotal moment for the organisation, you will partner closely with senior leaders to solve complex business challenges, translate insight into action, and help steer enterprise priorities. You will do this while leading the development of strategy talent and strengthening strategic capability across the organisation.

 

Key Responsibilities

 

Lead end-to-end delivery of high-impact strategic initiatives, distilling complexity into clear, actionable strategic choices
Partner with senior stakeholders to shape strategic options grounded in consumer, category, customer, competitor and organisational insights
Translate enterprise priorities into structured workstreams and mobilise cross-functional teams to deliver results
Develop financial models, scenario analysis and robust business cases to inform strategic decisions
Craft compelling executive-level narratives that cut through complexity and enable confident decision-making
Build trusted relationships across functions to drive alignment, pace and execution discipline
Manage, coach and develop Strategy Analysts, strengthening team capability and performance
Contribute to the evolution of strategy frameworks, tools and ways of working across the function

 

About You

 

You are a strategic thinker who combines analytical rigour with commercial instinct and the ability to turn ambiguity into clarity.

 

You will bring:

 

6-8+ years’ experience in corporate strategy or top-tier consulting
A track record of delivering complex strategic initiatives from analysis through implementation
Strong problem-solving capability and structured thinking
Financial and commercial acumen, including business case and modelling experience
Confidence engaging and influencing senior stakeholders
The ability to make the complex simple and translate insight into action

 

Why Asahi Beverages?

 

At Asahi Beverages, we're passionate about crafting more than just drinks - we craft moments of connection, celebration and shared enjoyment. We bring together a diverse portfolio of iconic beverage brands, a commitment to quality and a drive to constantly innovate.  Headquartered in Melbourne and with facilities right across Australia and New Zealand, you’ll find Asahi is a place where talent is nurtured and ambition is rewarded. If you’re ready to toast your future, we’re ready to meet you.

Your Impact

 

This is a pivotal leadership opportunity – created through internal progression – to shape the long-term direction of one of Australia’s most dynamic consumer businesses. Reporting to the General Manager, Strategy & Corporate Development, the Head of Strategy plays a central role in defining enterprise strategy, influencing executive decision-making and translating ambition into actionable outcomes.

 

You will be a critical leader in a high-performing strategy team while remaining personally embedded in complex, high-priority strategic work that drives sustainable growth and competitive advantage. Designed for a commercially minded strategy leader who balances thinking and doing, this role offers the opportunity to shape the organisation’s medium- and long-term strategic direction while ensuring strategy converts into measurable business outcomes across the enterprise.

 

Key Responsibilities

 

Lead development and delivery of the enterprise five-year strategy, translating strategic ambition into clear priorities, initiatives and execution pathways
Partner closely with executive leaders to define strategic choices that drive growth, profitability and long-term competitive advantage
Lead and develop a high-performing strategy function of 4-6 professionals, balancing direct leadership with broader cohort influence
Personally lead complex, high-impact strategic projects across commercial, data, operational and enterprise domains
Build robust, insight-driven business cases that inform executive and board-level decision making
Influence senior stakeholders through structured thinking, compelling narratives and pragmatic recommendations
Identify emerging risks and opportunities across the market landscape to strengthen competitive positioning
Coach and develop future strategy leaders while building succession capability within the function

 

About You

 

Minimum 8+ years’ experience in corporate strategy or management consulting, with demonstrated success within complex in-house enterprise environments
Strong strategic thinking combined with the ability to translate strategy into practical, executable outcomes
Excellent analytical capability, with the ability to synthesise complex information into clear insights and actionable recommendations
Commercially astute, with strong financial acumen and business case development expertise
Influential communicator able to engage, challenge and align senior stakeholders across the enterprise
Collaborative and curious, with strong outcomes focus and bias toward action
Comfortable navigating complexity and competing priorities within a fast-paced environment
Proven experience leading, coaching and developing high-performing talent and building strategy capability at scale

 

Why Asahi Beverages?

 

At Asahi Beverages, we're passionate about crafting more than just drinks - we craft moments of connection, celebration and shared enjoyment. We bring together a diverse portfolio of iconic beverage brands, a commitment to quality and a drive to constantly innovate.  Headquartered in Melbourne and with facilities right across Australia and New Zealand, you’ll find Asahi is a place where talent is nurtured and ambition is rewarded. If you’re ready to toast your future, we’re ready to meet you.

Ad Text:
What MinRes can offer

Exposure to innovative mining technologies and industry leading projects.
Opportunities for ongoing professional development, technical leadership, and advancement.
Comprehensive employee benefits supporting your career, health, family, recreation, and future with MinRes

The Opportunity
We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst to join our NextDigital team based at our head office in Osborne Park on a Monday to Friday work schedule.

As a Business Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions. You will work closely with stakeholders, ensuring that requirements are documented, processes are analysed and optimised, and business solutions are implemented successfully. This position suits a detail-oriented individual with strong analytical, communication, and problem-solving skills.

Key responsibilities

Collaborate with stakeholders to understand and document business requirements, ensuring they are clear, concise, and aligned with project objectives.
Maintain requirements documentation within DevOps, adhering to change control processes and mandatory attributes.
Achieve endorsement of requirements from business stakeholders.
Document and analyse business processes using industry standard notations and tools, recommending opportunities for improvement.
Work with cross-functional teams to streamline workflows and enhance operational efficiency.
Evaluate and propose technology solutions that meet documented requirements, ensuring feasibility and adherence to best practice.
Act as a liaison between business units and technical teams, facilitating workshops, meetings, and effective project communication.
Develop, review, and/or execute test plans and participate in user acceptance testing to ensure quality and stakeholder satisfaction.
Provide post-deployment issue triage and support where required.
Champion diversity, empowerment, and inclusive behaviour, celebrating differences and standing up for values-driven culture.

About you

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Technology, or a related field.

Experience:

Proven experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in a technology or software development environment.
Extensive experience working with SAP SuccessFactors, Azure DevOps, and Workforce Software highly regarded.

Mindset:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
Familiarity with business analysis tools and methodologies.
Adaptable to changing priorities and comfortable in a fast-paced environment.

About Mineral Resources (MinRes)

The Digital Technology Services (DTS) Project Delivery Team ensures successful delivery of technical solutions across the organisation, with strong focus on sustainable value through asset lifecycle. Mineral Resources (MinRes) is a leading, diversified resources company with a portfolio of operations in Western Australia.

 

At MinRes, the future’s bright. Be part of our next chapter

Our client is a large, nationally recognised organisation, headquartered in Sydney. With continued investment in technology and digital capability, they are focused on modernising core systems and strengthening long-term operational performance.

Reporting into the Technology, Data and Digital function, this 5-month contract Business Analyst will partner with cross-functional stakeholders to deliver a high-quality RFI/RFP for a major technology initiative. You will support vendor engagement, process design and evaluation activities, contributing to informed technology selection and operational change.

Key highlights:
5 month contract (day rate) with strong potential for extension
Sydney central location (Hybrid)
Strong experience required delivering RFI/RFPs through to completion
Duties / Key responsibilities
Gather and document detailed business and functional requirements for RFI/RFP documentation
Develop current and future state process maps, including “as-is” and “to-be” workflows
Establish and manage stakeholder relationships across business, technical teams and vendors
Define evaluation criteria including weighting, cost and functionality
Support vendor review, selection and broader BA activities as required
Skills and experience
Proven experience delivering end-to-end RFI/RFP processes within technology environments
Strong business process mapping and documentation capability
Experience across digital, system integration, data or analytics projects
Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills
Understanding of procurement and vendor evaluation frameworks
Experience in digital or publishing environments advantageous
If you’re interested in this opportunity and feel you’re the right fit please click “apply” or contact Abbie Goodison (abbie.goodison@allurapartners.com.au).

About Allura Partners
Allura Partners was founded to support private equity firms by placing C-Suites to lead, transform, and scale portfolio companies. Today, in addition to our proven private equity specialisation, we’ve become a trusted partner for major ASX-listed and private enterprises in Australia, offering executive search, recruitment, and business transformation. Known for integrity, reliability, and results, our expertise spans Executive Search, Accounting & Finance, Transformation & Change, and Technology & Digital. We connect businesses and top-tier talent, exceeding expectations and driving lasting impact.

About Us

Fortescue is both a proud West Australian company and a global green solutions business. We are recognised for our culture, innovation and industry-leading development of infrastructure, mining assets and green energy initiatives.

Our Opportunity

Work Location: Perth - Fortescue's Perth office is located on the traditional lands of the Whadjuk Noongar people. Ad hoc domestic and/or international travel may be required.

Roster: Monday to Friday

Fortescue are presently looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join the Data & AI team.

Effective team members in this area combine a vision for the future with a focus on value, curiosity, and creativity. They harness the power of data, data science, and AI to fuel innovation, unlock new opportunities, solve complex challenges, streamline processes, and enable strategic advancements that align with Fortescue's Vision.

The Science skill tree attracts, retains, and grows the careers of individuals who are passionate about creating and implementing advanced data-driven solutions. These team members are key to empowering decision-making and operational efficiency across Fortescue, ensuring all solutions inform and support the company's broader objectives.

Key Responsibilities

Deliver data analysis and insights by extracting, interpreting, and visualising complex datasets to inform strategic decisions and communicate actionable outcomes to stakeholders
Design, develop, and optimise AI and machine learning models, ensuring they are scalable, secure, ethical, and aligned with Fortescue's business objectives
Contribute to IT strategy and planning, aligning data science initiatives with corporate goals while assessing emerging technologies and their potential applications
Identify and implement process improvement opportunities, leveraging data-driven insights to enhance operational efficiency and support smooth change management
Develop and maintain high-quality software and analytical solutions, applying best practices in programming, testing, and solution architecture to ensure system reliability and performance
Support data management and engineering activities, building and optimising data pipelines, ensuring data integrity, accessibility, and compliance with security standards
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and validate requirements, translating business needs into technical specifications for data science and AI projects
Lead research and innovation efforts, exploring emerging tools, techniques, and methodologies to expand data science capabilities and organisational impact
Document and share knowledge effectively, maintaining accessible repositories of methodologies, frameworks, and performance measures to drive continuous learning
Mentor and support team members, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence in data science practice.

Qualifications and Experience

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, mathematics, statistics, machine learning, or a related field
Experience (3+ years) in data science and AI solution system development in the mining, energy, green energy, or heavy industrial operations preferred
Strong practical expertise in statistics and machine learning, including causal inference, experimental design, and applied analytical modelling
Proficient in Python and SQL, with hands-on experience using leading ML frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch for model development and deployment
Comprehensive background in AI/ML disciplines, including natural language processing (traditional and LLM-based), computer vision, and predictive analytics
Skilled in modern data science tools and practices, including version control with Git and adherence to software engineering best practices
Experience working with data and ML platforms such as Snowflake, Amazon S3, Databricks, and SageMaker (highly regarded)
Knowledge of cloud infrastructure including AWS and Azure environments, supporting scalable data processing and ML operations
Demonstrated ability to manage and influence stakeholders, fostering collaboration across technical, operational, and business teams
Excellent communication and storytelling skills, able to convey complex technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences
Analytical and problem-solving mindset, with a proactive approach to identifying insights, optimising models, and resolving challenges.

Our Commitment

Fortescue is deeply committed to providing a safe culture that builds respect, fosters inclusiveness, and values diversity. We celebrate individual strengths and team members from all backgrounds are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work. Our global workforce drives and promotes an inclusive culture, both within our organisation and throughout the communities we interact with across the world. Diverse backgrounds include First Nations Peoples, people with differing abilities, LGBTIQ+ community, gender, neurodiverse, cultural diversity, all age groups, and those with an intersectional or multiple diverse characteristics. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

https://fortescue.com/careers

Internal Candidates / Current Contractors please apply via Success Factors Careers Portal. For further information on how to apply please visit the Fortescue Hub.

Fortescue reserves the right to close applications early should a suitable pool of candidates be identified. Fortescue will never contact you to ask for payment of any kind, whether directly or through a third party.

Salary: $140k base plus super plus salary sacrifice
Ad Text:
If you are a Change Analyst with a drive to work in the for-purpose sector, this might be just the role you’ve been looking for.

 

This role has been newly created in an organisation undergoing rapid change and expansion.

 

Reporting directly to the Senior Change Manager, you will play a critical role in facilitating business change initiatives by gathering, analysing, and communicating data and insights.

 

You will  provide business and change analysis support by identifying people, processes and systems impact, supporting readiness tracking.

This role requires a strong technical aptitude, proficiency in utilising AI tools, and exceptional storytelling and communication skills.

 

Key Responsibilities will include:

 

Support the Senior Change Manager in delivering organisation-wide business change objectives.
Build comprehensive information packs and perform data analysis to support decision making.
Apply technology and AI tools to enhance change analysis and communication processes.
Plan and run workshops to gather research data from stakeholders and business users.
Document findings thoroughly and create relevant change artifacts.
Utilise your strong communication skills and storytelling experience to convey change impact and benefits clearly.
Collaborate closely with stakeholders to ensure a smooth transition during change initiatives.

 

Required Qualifications and Skills:

 

Proven experience as a Business Change Analyst or similar.
Strong technical skills with a solid understanding of data analysis and the ability to leverage AI technologies.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a passion for storytelling and crafting compelling narratives.
Experience facilitating workshops and engaging with diverse stakeholders to gather and validate requirements.
Highly organised with the ability to document and produce change management artifacts effectively.
Familiarity with change management frameworks and tools and advanced Microsoft  Suite skills
Experience working within large or complex change programs, particularly in the not-for-profit / for-purpose sector, healthcare or similar

 

What is Offer:

 

Opportunity to work with senior leadership and contribute to impactful business change initiatives.
Collaborative and supportive team environment.
Competitive salary package with superannuation and tax incentives (through salary sacrifice).
Flexible working arrangement with hybrid office attendance/ WFH and available parking, as well as close proximity to public transport.

 

Additional Information:

 

This is an 18-month fixed term, full-time role with an expected start date of as soon as possible.

The salary on offer is up to $140k base plus super plus NFP salary sacrifice worth approx. $15,900 pa

 

 

 

 

Balance Recruitment is committed to equal opportunity employment. We celebrate diversity and encourage people from all sections of our community to apply for this role. 

 

If this role is located in Victoria, this posting was placed on behalf of Balance Consulting Services who will provide all services related to the recruitment of this position (BCS).





Balance Recruitment is committed to equal opportunity employment.  We celebrate diversity and encourage people from all sections of the community to apply.

Our client is a major government department delivering comprehensive education service to people of NSW.
About the Role
The agency is leveraging artificial intelligence to support teaching, learning and business efficiency through initiatives such as Chatbots, AI Search platforms and targeted AI proof of concepts.
We are seeking a Senior Business Analyst to join the AI Engineering Team. This role is focused on business analysis, stakeholder engagement, high quality documentation and translating complex AI concepts into clear, practical outcomes for non-technical audiences.
The role is centred on business analysis and stakeholder alignment rather than delivery ownership working closely with data science and development team.

Objectives of this Role:

Understand business challenges across its education providers and corporate areas and identify where AI capabilities can support measurable improvements.
Analyse large data sets to generate insights, propose new success metrics and recommend strategies to address operational needs.
Translate emerging AI and technical concepts into clear, plain language for executives, business stakeholders and school audiences.
Facilitate structured workshops to gather requirements, validate assumptions and share POC findings.
Document current and future state processes, developing clear process flows, charts and visual artefacts to support business understanding and outcomes.
Develop high quality User Stories with clear, structured and testable Acceptance Criteria.
Understand and operate within the NSW Artificial Intelligence Assurance Framework.
Maintain a well-structured Backlog, ensuring Epics and User Stories are clearly defined, prioritised and written in plain, user-friendly language accessible to both business and technical audiences.
Understand and operate within the NSW Artificial Intelligence Assurance Framework.
Key Responsibilities

Lead stakeholder engagement to gather, analyse and document clear, validated business requirements across complex environments.
Facilitate structured workshops to define requirements, validate process changes and support endorsement of AI initiatives.
Develop high-quality user stories with testable acceptance criteria, while identifying risks, assumptions and business impacts.
Translate complex AI and data concepts into clear, executive-ready communication, articulating benefits, limitations and trade-offs.
Produce and maintain robust process documentation, governance artefacts and business-facing explanations of AI solutions.
Required Skills and Experience

Significant experience as a Business Analyst in complex technology or digital environments.
Experience working on data driven or emerging technology initiatives.
Strong workshop facilitation skills across diverse stakeholder groups.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
Proven ability to translate complex technical concepts into language suitable for non-technical audiences.
Demonstrated experience developing detailed user stories with clear, structured and testable acceptance criteria.
Strong process mapping and documentation capability.
Ability to navigate ambiguity and operate effectively in innovative, fast-moving environments.
Strong understanding of governance, risk and compliance considerations in public sector environments.
Preferred Experience

Experience in the education sector or large public sector organisations.
Exposure to generative AI, search technologies, NLP or machine learning concepts.
Experience supporting proof of concepts and scaling validated solutions.
Familiarity with AI governance, copyright and data risk considerations in enterprise environments.
Proven track record of working on new products.
Ability to work effectively in a dynamic, research-oriented team.
Experience with innovation accelerators or startup environments.
Proven success in a collaborative, team oriented environment.
Consultant : Sam Baidya

Keywords: Artificial Intelligence, AI, NSW government, education, Artificial Intelligence Assessment Framework (AIAF), Digital Assurance Framework (DAF), NSW AI Ethics Principles, assurance, risk assessment, governance

Ad Text:
Work.

Are you a strategic thinker with a passion for Data? Join Sunwater as a Principal Business Analyst where you’ll play a vital role in providing quality assurance and peer reviews of key business analysis deliverables, ensuring that all outputs meet high standards of quality, accuracy, and relevance​. You will lead business analysis activities on projects that are large in scale, complex in nature, or carry significant risk, ensuring that all analysis activities are thorough, accurate, and effectively support project objectives.​

As a Principal Business Analyst at Sunwater, you will:

Drive strategic outcomes of business analysis practices within the organisation, ensuring that methodologies and approaches align to best practice​
Contribute to organisational capability uplift through insight and analysis to inform and shape the organisation's strategic direction, ensuring that business analysis contributes meaningfully to achieving strategic goals.​
Develop and implement standardized analysis frameworks, methodologies, and toolkits, ensuring consistency and quality across all business analysis activities within Sunwater​

We are seeking a talented individual with a strong background in data analytics. You will hold tertiary qualifications in IT or business, equivalent experience, and Business Analyst certification (CBAP or PMI-PBA) or equivalent industry experience. You will also bring:

Influence: Influence business and IT leadership through thought leadership, providing expert insights and recommendations that drive informed decision-making and strategic alignment.
Strategic vision: Ability to design and deliver strategies and programs across the business.
Communication skills: Excellent communication skills with a knack for writing and presenting quality reports and findings to senior leadership, including the Board and executive leadership team

This role offers an array of attractive benefits including:

Base salary starting from $177,904.01
12.75% superannuation
Access to banked time and TOIL
17.5% leave loading
A genuine emphasis on work/life balance

Water.

Imagine a career where your work truly matters, where you are part of a team that values you and your contributions. At Sunwater, you will bring life’s most essential resource to over 4,500 agriculture, urban and industrial customers, helping to sustain communities and deliver water for prosperity across regional Queensland. We share the values of these communities — starting with caring about our people. Engage in fascinating work that is constantly evolving, allowing you to grow and shape a successful career and develop unique skills and experience in an industry brimming with opportunity.

Life.

At Sunwater, we believe our employees are our greatest asset, and we are committed to providing the support, resources and benefits that you need to thrive. That's why we offer a range of attractive benefits designed to help you bring your best every day, including:

My benefits: Access employee benefits and discounts hosted by Reward Gateway
My wellbeing: Prioritise your wellbeing with our comprehensive health and wellness offerings and programs
My time: Enjoy flexible working arrangements and the ability to purchase up to 4 additional weeks of leave, ensuring you can tailor your work to fit your lifestyle
My growth: We prioritise your professional growth with career development programs, study assistance, support for professional memberships, and structured early career pathways to help you build a rewarding and successful career

Now is the perfect time to join Sunwater and take advantage of the boundless opportunities for your career today and in the future.  We are a diverse team and proud of the unique journeys and stories each of us brings. As we continue to grow, we need more diverse backgrounds and perspectives than ever before. We are committed to a barrier-free recruitment process and work environment. If you require any accommodations, please let us know so we can ensure you can fully participate in our recruitment experience, which includes reference verification, psychometric testing, background checks and a pre-employment medical evaluation to ensure the best fit for our team.

Sunwater acknowledges Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples as the first peoples of this country and Traditional Custodians of the land and water we rely on. We are seeking two experienced BI Specialists to join a high-performing Insights and Analytics function supporting large-scale enterprise transformation and migration programs.

These roles sit within a Business Intelligence practice focused on delivering trusted data, decision support, and high-quality reporting solutions used by senior stakeholders across the business.

This is an excellent opportunity for BI professionals who combine strong technical capability with excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills.

About the Role

As a BI Specialist, you will sit on top of an established data asset and focus on information provision and decision support, translating complex data into clear, consumable insights for business users.

You will be responsible for building intuitive Power BI reporting solutions and working closely with non-technical stakeholders to help guide decision-making.

Key Responsibilities

Build and maintain Power BI dashboards and front-end reporting solutions

Develop strong DAX measures and data models

Use SQL and Python to aggregate, analyse and prepare data outputs

Deliver clear, actionable insights to business stakeholders

Present complex data concepts in an easy-to-understand way

Provide support to business users and act as a key point of contact for reporting questions

Contribute to continuous improvement of BI capability and reporting standards

Explore and support AI / Copilot integration where applicable

Skills and Experience Required

Proven experience in a Business Intelligence / BI Specialist / BI Developer role

Strong Power BI development skills (or equivalent enterprise BI tooling)

Advanced DAX capability

Solid SQL and Python skills

Background within Finance or Financial Services (essential)

Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills

Ability to work closely with business users and explain technical concepts clearly

Highly Regarded

Experience integrating BI solutions with Microsoft Copilot or AI-enabled tooling

Exposure to enterprise BI / BAU data production environments

Experience with large-scale transformation or migration programs

Contract Details

Initial 12-month contract

Strong likelihood of extension to 24 months

Potential pathway to permanent employment for high performers

Two-stage interview process plus informal final discussion

Why This Opportunity?

Join a growing BI practice with multiple upcoming roles

Work directly with senior analytics leaders

Highly visible, stakeholder-facing work

Opportunity to shape how business intelligence supports key programs

Senior Business Analyst – Data & Reporting
Melbourne | Hybrid (3 days onsite) | Contract

A major metropolitan healthcare network is undertaking a multi-year digital transformation program to establish itself as an independent, digitally resilient organisation.

We are seeking an experienced Senior Business Analyst to support a large-scale data and reporting rationalisation initiative. This role will work across business, data and vendor teams to define reporting requirements, streamline reporting outputs and support delivery of enterprise analytics solutions.

The Role You will act as the bridge between business stakeholders and technical data teams, ensuring reporting outputs are accurate, governed and aligned to organisational objectives.

Key responsibilities include:

Engage stakeholders to capture reporting, dashboard and KPI requirements
Facilitate workshops and translate needs into structured user stories and functional documentation
Define KPIs, measures, dimensions and calculations
Analyse source systems and map data to reporting datasets
Work alongside Data Architects and Engineers to define semantic layers and business definitions
Review vendor deliverables including dashboards, data models and transformation logic
Support UAT, defect triage and validation of reporting outputs
Contribute to reporting governance, data dictionaries and rationalisation artefacts
What We’re Looking For
Proven experience as a Senior BA within data, reporting or transformation programs
Strong stakeholder engagement and workshop facilitation capability
Experience working across business and technical data teams
Exposure to enterprise reporting platforms such as:

Power BI
Microsoft Fabric
Azure Data Platform
Enterprise Data Warehouses / Data Lakes
Experience documenting reporting requirements, data flows and transformations
Strong communication and documentation skills
Ability to manage ambiguity in complex environments
Healthcare experience is advantageous but not essential.

Are you a data science expert passionate about AI innovation and stakeholder influence? We’re seeking a Senior Data Scientist to drive cutting-edge AI advancements while working closely with executives and non-technical stakeholders to shape AI adoption and impact.
This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of technical excellence and business strategy, ensuring AI solutions deliver real value across the organisation.

About the Role
Join a rapidly growing AI-driven organisation at the forefront of innovation in LLMs, NLP, and Generative AI. This role is ideal for a hands-on data scientist who thrives in building scalable AI solutions, experimenting with state-of-the-art models, and driving real-world impact through applied research and engineering excellence. You’ll work across multi-cloud environments, collaborate with technical and business stakeholders, and help shape the next generation of intelligent systems.
Key Responsibilities
LLM & NLP Development – Design, fine-tune, and deploy advanced large language models (PEFT, LoRA, PPO) to solve complex business challenges.
GenAI & RAG Engineering – Build and optimise retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines, embedding models, and agentic AI architectures.
MLOps & Deployment – Implement scalable ML workflows with CI/CD, monitoring, benchmarking, and automation best practices across AWS, GCP, or Azure.
Collaboration & Influence – Work closely with cross-functional teams to translate AI research into production-ready solutions that deliver measurable outcomes.
Continuous Research – Stay ahead of emerging trends in LLMs, transformers, reinforcement learning, and generative architectures.
What You’ll Bring
4–8 years of hands-on experience in data science, AI, or machine learning, with deep knowledge of NLP and LLM applications.
Strong proficiency in Python, PyTorch, and SQL, plus experience with frameworks such as LangChain, Hugging Face, or LlamaIndex.
Practical experience building RAG pipelines, integrating vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, FAISS), and deploying solutions through Databricks, SageMaker, or Vertex AI.
Understanding of MLOps, monitoring, and feature store design, ensuring performance and reliability at scale.
Curiosity and drive to experiment with new architectures, delivering meaningful improvements to model capability and business value.
What’s in It for You
Contribute to cutting-edge AI initiatives in a fast-paced, high-impact environment.
Collaborate with talented engineers, researchers, and product leaders who share a passion for innovation.
Access modern tech stacks, flexible hybrid working, and opportunities to shape enterprise-level GenAI adoption.
Be part of a team that values curiosity, technical mastery, and solving real-world problems with AI.

If you’re a highly experienced AI professional who can influence at an executive level while delivering cutting-edge AI solutions, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now!

About the role:

We are seeking an experienced Internal Audit Manager – Technology & Projects to lead and deliver audits across technology, data, information security, and program and project controls. In this role, you will support the execution of the Internal Audit Plan and Strategy while acting as a trusted advisor to stakeholders across the organisation.

You will play a key role in strengthening the Bank’s control environment, delivering insights, and contributing to the continuous uplift of technology and data capability within Internal Audit.

Specifically, you will:

Lead end-to-end internal audit engagements across technology, information security, and program/project controls.

Assess technology and information security controls within corporate and operational audits, identifying risks and improvement opportunities.

Provide practical recommendations and commercial insights to enhance risk management and controls.

Prepare and present audit reports to senior management and governance committees and monitor agreed actions.

Build strong stakeholder relationships and represent Internal Audit across relevant technology forums.

Contribute to the Internal Audit Plan, methodology improvements, and strategic initiatives to enhance audit efficiency and effectiveness.

About You:

You are a driven and collaborative audit or risk professional with strong technology expertise and the confidence to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels. You bring a pragmatic mindset, commercial awareness, and a passion for improving controls and risk outcomes.

We also seek: 

Demonstrated experience in IT Internal Audit, technology risk, IT operations, technology project delivery, or compliance with a technology focus.

A relevant tertiary qualification in technology or a related discipline.

Professional certification such as CISA, CISSP, CIA, ITIL, or an equivalent credential.

Proven ability to independently lead audit engagements from planning through to reporting and stakeholder sign-off.

Strong analytical, communication, and relationship-management skills, with the ability to translate technical risks into business insights.

A proactive, solution-focused approach with the ability to work autonomously, manage competing priorities, and deliver to deadlines.

Candidates who demonstrate the following will highly regarded:

Knowledge of relevant frameworks and standards such as CPS 234, ISO 27000 series, ITIL, NIST CSF, or PCI-DSS.

Project management certifications or exposure to delivery methodologies (e.g., PRINCE2, PMBOK, Agile).

Why you’ll love working with us:

People First Bank – our new brand – says exactly what we’re all about: people. We're committed to supporting and growing our team and creating an outstanding work environment.

You’ll have access to financial and lifestyle benefits to support your success and individuality:

Flexibility and hybrid working arrangements.

Extend your salary with discounts on banking, health insurance, and shopping across Australia.

Advance your career with training, study support, and project opportunities.

Competitive leave benefits that empower employees to take time for themselves and loved ones.

Wellbeing support with our Employee Assistance Program, wellbeing leave, mental health app, and mental health ambassadors’ program.

Make a difference with paid volunteering, Workplace Giving, and diverse community initiatives.

Be recognised for your contributions through our peer-driven recognition program.

A bit about People First Bank: 

In March 2023, People’s Choice and Heritage Bank merged to form Heritage and People’s Choice Limited - Australia's leading mutual bank.  We are now on an exciting journey to bring together our products, services, and technology under a single brand - People First Bank.

We have over 700,000 members and 1,900 employees, with dual head offices in Adelaide and Toowoomba, an Australian-based contact centre and branches across five states. 

With a vision ‘To deliver positive change through banking’, People First Bank serves members and contributes to the community, while offering an inclusive, flexible work environment. We’re big enough to make an impact; but agile enough to influence and do interesting work.

Apply online now:

If this sounds like you, this could be the next step in your career. Click 'Apply' now and submit your application, including a cover letter and current resume. 

We are committed to diversity and inclusion and support candidate requests for adjustments to enable everyone to equitably participate in our selection process.

Company Description

About SEEK

SEEK’s portfolio of diverse businesses make a positive impact on a truly global scale. Our purpose is to help people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and help organisations succeed. We create world-class technology solutions to connect more people to relevant employment, education, small business and volunteer opportunities. We have a culture of high-performance in our workplaces and celebrate the diversity of our employees who contribute to the success of our organisation.

Life at SEEK

SEEK’s purpose is at the centre of everything we do. Our SEEK, which defines the way we work, is all about what makes us unique and a little bit different. Passion, Team, Delivery and Future are our principles that drive innovation and creativity. SEEK strives to support employee wellbeing by providing an amazing experience at work which led us to being named AFR BOSS Top 10 Best Places to Work in Technology (2021-2024). We are proud to work in an environment that's inclusive where everyone's unique ideas, experiences and perspectives are valued.

Our award-winning head office in Cremorne (just a 4 min walk from Richmond station) provides an exceptional space to collaborate with colleagues. The building provides sweeping views of the city, a games area, sit and stand desks at every workstation, modern end-of-trip facilities and Thursday night drinks which gives our people an opportunity to connect in a social setting.

Job Description

As a Senior Strategy Manager at SEEK, you'll play a pivotal role in defining and delivering our long-term vision and growth ambitions. Focused on topics within SEEK's APAC product strategy as part of the Strategy Operations Centre of Gravity, you'll tackle some of our most critical and complex challenges, spanning multiple product and AI domains.

You'll lead deep strategic thinking, apply analytical rigour, and turn insights into action. This role suits someone who thrives in ambiguity, is energised by solving complex business problems, and is excited by the opportunity to shape SEEK's future at scale.

What You'll Be Doing

✅ Lead strategy projects spanning multiple product and AI domains, becoming the 'go-to' expert for senior leadership and the broader organisation
✅ Develop and apply analytical frameworks to investigate business issues, identify solutions and make recommendations
✅ Create situational awareness across the organisation through strategic metrics, key results, industry trends and competitor analysis
✅ Communicate strategy with simplicity and impact to all levels—from senior executives to delivery teams
✅ Collaborate in project teams alongside Product, AI and Technology stakeholders to design, test and iterate future solutions
✅ Be a vocal advocate for the strategy, providing guidance to execution teams to ensure alignment

The Opportunity

You'll join SEEK's global Strategy team, a high-performing group of ~40 ex-consultants from premier firms, working across APAC.  With exposure to some of SEEK's most senior leaders, including the Head of Strategy Operations, Directors of Strategy, and Group Executives of Product, AI and Technology, you'll have a rare opportunity to shape the long-term direction of one of the region's most recognised tech brands. Our team culture is caring, curious and impact-oriented, and we're united by a shared purpose: helping people live more fulfilling and productive working lives.

Qualifications

✔ 5-8 years' experience in strategy-related roles, with 3-4 years in a top-tier strategy consulting firm
✔ Highly developed conceptual reasoning, analytical and problem-solving skills with proven ability to frame strategic problems
✔ Experience in developing business-level strategy and breaking this down into objectives, targets and initiatives
✔ Track record of delivering results through cross-functional teams
✔ Ability to influence and build support for fact-based recommendations with diverse stakeholders
✔ High learning orientation and desire to become a global expert in online marketplace design and operations
✔ Passion for growth strategy and excellent business acumen, with experience leading complex and ambiguous strategic projects
✔ Experience in media, internet or tech industries is a plus

Additional Information

At SEEK we offer:

Annual Performance Bonus Plan
Support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role.
Paid and unpaid leave benefits including Personal Flexi Days and Volunteer Days, as well as the opportunity to purchase additional leave
Support for parents with 14 weeks paid primary carers leave and 2 weeks paid leave for partners
The opportunity to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per financial year
Free income protection insurance

At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.

We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.

Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.

For this role, only those candidates with the eligible right to work will be considered.

SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

Lead the development of scalable, reliable enterprise reporting and analytics
Drive data‑led insights that shape strategy, performance, and customer outcomes
Champion a single source of truth across PetSure and its brand partners

 

At PetSure, we’re passionate about creating a world that’s better for pets and their people. As a Senior Business Intelligence Developer, you’ll play a critical role in transforming data into meaningful insights that support better decisions, stronger performance, and improved pet healthcare moments.

 

You’ll be a senior member of the Business Intelligence team, responsible for designing robust data models, developing engaging dashboards, and partnering closely with stakeholders across the business. From executive reporting to forward‑looking analytics, your work will help ensure PetSure has accurate, trusted, and actionable insights at every level.

 

If you’re a data expert who enjoys solving complex problems, influencing stakeholders, and building analytics solutions that scale—this could be the role for you.

 

What You’ll Do

Design and deliver enterprise‑grade reports, dashboards, and analytical models
Develop and maintain scalable data warehouse and semantic model solutions
Provide insight and analysis across claims, service, sales, cancellations, and product performance
Partner with stakeholders to translate business questions into data‑driven answers
Champion data governance, quality, and a “single version of the truth”
Mentor junior BI team members and influence data‑led decision making across the organisation

 

What You’ll Bring

8+ years’ experience in a Business Intelligence or analytics role
Expert‑level skills across the MSBI stack (T‑SQL, Power BI, SSRS, SSIS, SSAS, DAX)
Strong experience designing data warehouses, semantic models, and analytical layers
High technical & coding capability with mindset towards optimised and efficient solutions
Excellent analytical thinking with a passion for accuracy, insight, and storytelling
Ability to work collaboratively with technical and non‑technical stakeholders
Experience with Azure data services, Databricks, or Power Platform tools (desirable)

 

Why You’ll Love Working at PetSure

Flexible working – hybrid model based in Chatswood
Pet benefits – discounted pet insurance and pet care leave
Wellbeing support – mental health programs and flu vaccinations
Professional development – learning pathways and career progression
Recognition and rewards – incentive programs and milestone celebrations

 

Join Our Team

At PetSure, we live by our values:

Passion for pets and their people
Curious and open to pawsibilities
Chewing through problems and opportunities
Taking care of others

 

We’re an equal opportunity employer and welcome applicants from all backgrounds. Our pet‑friendly environment means you can bring your furry friend to work!

 

Ready to turn data into impact and help shape the future of pet healthcare? Apply now!

Our client is seeking a highly technical, delivery-focused Data Analyst to own and evolve their core analytics capability.

This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who thrives in retail environments and enjoys engaging with senior business stakeholders to drive data-led decisions.

This is a hands-on role centred on Snowflake, advanced SQL engineering, and enterprise-level Tableau development and server administration.

You'll partner directly with senior leadership to deliver scalable data models, executive dashboards, and actionable commercial insights across sales, customer, and operational performance.

Key Responsibilities

Design, build and optimise scalable Snowflake data models.
Write high-performance, production-grade SQL (complex joins, transformations, performance tuning).
Automate and streamline reporting pipelines.
Develop and enhance executive-level Tableau dashboards.
Administer Tableau Server.
Partner with commercial leaders to deliver actionable insights.
Translate business requirements into sustainable data solutions.

About You

You are technically strong, commercially minded, and comfortable engaging senior stakeholders.

Required Experience:

Strong hands-on Snowflake expertise.
Advanced SQL capability (complex transformations, optimisation, performance tuning).
Proven Tableau dashboard development experience.
Tableau Server administration experience.
Experience delivering reporting within commercial, retail, or sales-driven environments.
Confidence working with senior leadership.
Ability to work independently and effectively within a team environment.

The client offers 3 days in office / 2 days from home hybrid working model.

Principal Policy & Research Analyst
Government Contract Role
Brisbane CBD
16 March 2026 – 30 June 2026
$122.86 per hour + super
We are seeking a highly experienced Principal Policy & Research Analyst to drive the strategic redesign of domestic and family violence (DFV), violent, and sexual offending programs within custodial settings across Queensland.
This is a high-impact contract opportunity for a subject matter expert who combines academic rigour with operational pragmatism.

About the Role
You will lead the evidence review, comparative analysis, and strategic program scoping required to modernise custodial rehabilitation frameworks for complex offending cohorts.

Key Responsibilities

National & International Jurisdictional Scan
Map contemporary legislative, policy, and program frameworks across diverse jurisdictions.
Deliver high-level comparative appraisals highlighting transferable innovations.
Evaluate integration of custodial interventions with community-based throughcare models.
Specialist Literature Review
Conduct comprehensive reviews of DFV, violent and sexual offending research.
Synthesise trauma-informed and evidence-based methodologies.
Identify emerging trends in perpetrator intervention and victim-survivor safety.
Highlight evidence gaps, particularly for high-risk cohorts in secure environments.
Program Mapping & Comparative Analysis
Undertake an end-to-end audit of existing custodial programs.
Assess operational viability, clinical risk, and delivery feasibility.
Analyse financial impacts, staffing models, and infrastructure requirements.
Integrated Program Scoping & Design
Architect a modular “Base + Module” intervention framework.
Ensure strict alignment with Risk, Need, and Responsivity principles.
Develop a detailed implementation blueprint including costs, resourcing and delivery protocols.
Embed robust victim-survivor safety and perpetrator accountability measures.
Relationship & Stakeholder Management
Collaborate closely with the project team to deliver outcomes on schedule.
Coordinate and translate expert input into actionable project outputs.
Facilitate workshops, focus groups and consultations.
Design and lead stakeholder engagement strategies.
Build consensus across competing priorities and ensure feedback integration.
Maintain proactive communication regarding risks, roadblocks or resource requirements.
About You
You are a recognised subject matter expert in criminology, criminal justice, or social policy with:

Deep expertise in the Risk-Need-Responsivity framework
Strong knowledge of DFV, violent and sexual offending interventions
Experience conducting high-level literature reviews and jurisdictional comparisons
Demonstrated ability to translate research into operational policy design
Experience working within custodial, justice, or government environments highly regarded
Strong analytical, financial modelling, and strategic scoping capabilities
You are motivated by the opportunity to apply your expertise to systemic reform in a high-stakes public sector environment.


At Chandler Macleod, we are committed to fostering a diverse workforce where everyone is welcome. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, women, neurodiverse, people living with a disability and the LGBTIQA+ community.

Take hold of a monster opportunity and join our Business Risk Management team as a Risk Manager Governance Insights.  If you’re a good fit for this role and live in Brisbane or Sydney, we’d love you to apply. 

Why join us?

You'll get 14% super as standard, to help your future come alive.
Unleash your potential and build a career to be proud of through excellent training and development opportunities.
Balance your work between in-person days at our purpose-built hubs and working from home.
In the office, enjoy end of trip facilities, a yoga and multi-faith room, parent and carer rooms, quiet rooms, BrewHub coffee facilities, and collaborative team spaces.

About the role

We’re all about helping our members make the most of their money. And while they go after their goals, you can too. We’re looking for a manager to support building and embedding a contemporary Line 1 risk governance, reporting and insights function within our Business Risk Management team. You’ll support the establishment of the strategy, be part of a high‑performing team, and partner with senior leaders across the enterprise to uplift risk maturity and drive consistent practices aligned to ART’s Risk Management Framework.

 

Day to day, you'll:

Support the Risk Governance team’s strategy and operating model;
Ensure effective risk forums and rhythms are in place across the enterprise; coordinate Line 1 risk reporting for executive and board forums; identify enterprise‑wide insights and priorities.
Lead the annual Trustee Risk Management Declaration and support risk appetite metric assessment and reporting.
Participate to the maintenance of a Line 1 risk community of practice across the enterprise and lift risk capability across the business.
Design and implement Line 1 risk reporting and analytics frameworks; leverage AI and emerging tech to deliver efficient, decision‑ready insights.
Partner with the business, their line 1 risk managers, Line 2 and Line 3 to embed robust risk culture and practices and contribute to board‑level reporting.

This role is a permanent opportunity. 

About you

It goes without saying you'll be a great communicator with top notch interpersonal skills. We'll also expect you to pick up problems and come up with quick, creative ways to solve them. It's quite likely you tick some of the following boxes too:  

Tertiary qualifications in Risk, Business, Law or related discipline.
Deep knowledge of enterprise/operational risk and compliance within superannuation/insurance‑in‑super, including APRA prudential standards.
Strong Line 1 and/or Line 2 experience across governance, control frameworks, incident management, analytics and Board reporting.
Strong experience within the Financial Services industry, especially within Superannuation industry
Proven team leadership and change capability; able to operate at pace amid ambiguity while balancing BAU, future design and transformation.

About us

Our 2.4 million members trust us to take care of over $330 billion in retirement savings. And we help them take charge of their finances and face the future with confidence. Our inclusive culture means you’ll be valued and heard in a respectful workplace. We've created an environment where you can be yourself and do amazing work. It's that simple.

Apply online now

Everyone is welcome to apply. We value diverse thinking, cultures, perspectives, backgrounds, and abilities. Awaken your career at Australian Retirement Trust and apply now. Applications close Tuesday, 10 March 2026. 

We don’t want to leave you with a monstrous wait. So, you’ll hear from us after the closing date to find out whether you’ve made it through to the next round or not. Being fair and up-front is important to us – and recruitment is no different.

Job Title: Senior Financial Planning & Analysis Business Partner
Ad Text:
Location - Sydney or Brisbane, Australia
Work Arrangement - Hybrid




The Senior FP&A Business Partner is a critical role within the FP&A CoE, providing end‑to‑end financial planning, consolidation, and performance insight to support effective decision‑making across the business. The role plays a central part in end‑of‑month performance management, budgeting, forecasting, and long‑range planning, pulling together financial results, operational inputs, and key drivers into a coherent, decision‑ready view for senior leadership. The role partners closely with various areas across the business to ensure alignment between actual performance, forecasts, and strategic plans. 




The role plays a critical part in driving performance excellence, leveraging continuous improvement (LEAN) principles, SAP S/4HANA, automation, and effective change management to improve recovery accuracy, reduce leakage, and enhance end‑to‑end process efficiency. The role also works closely with offshore shared service centres to standardise processes, improve data quality, and enable scalable, efficient operations.







What we do at Weir
We are a global leader in mining technology for a sustainable future. We help our customers extract the resources the world needs more efficiently and more sustainably. Our planet’s future depends on the transition to renewable energy, and that transition can only happen with the metals and minerals our customers deliver. So, we work side by side with mines across the globe to move less rock, use less energy, use water wisely, and create less waste. Together, we drive the shift to smart, efficient, and more sustainable mining.




Make your impact
You’ll play a key role in solving real-world challenges. You’ll apply your skills to deliver results that matter whether that’s through engineering, planning or customer support. You’ll work with purpose, learn every day and help shape a more sustainable future.







What you’ll do

Performance Management: Own and coordinate the FP&A contribution to month-end close, consolidating financial results, flash reporting, and performance analysis to provide a clear, decision-ready view for senior leadership.

Business Partnering: Act as a trusted FP&A partner to senior business and finance stakeholders, with a strong focus on business partnering to ensure alignment between actual performance, forecasts, and strategic plans.

Budgeting & Forecasting: Lead the coordination and consolidation of budgets, forecasts, and long-range plans, developing driver-based models linking operational activity to financial outcomes, challenging assumptions to ensure robust and transparent plans.

Reporting & Insights: Provide clear, decision-oriented insights by translating financial results, forecasts, and trends into actionable narratives; review and improve management and executive reporting for relevance and alignment with key value drivers.

Continuous Improvement: Apply LEAN principles and automation to streamline FP&A processes, improve recovery accuracy, reduce leakage, and enhance end-to-end process efficiency.

Systems & Governance: Serve as a key FP&A SME for planning and reporting tools including SAP S/4HANA; ensure strong data governance, reconciliation, and control across planning and reporting cycles.

Safety First: Demonstrate 100% commitment to our zero harm behaviors in support of our drive towards developing a world-class safety culture.







What you’ll bring


Must-haves:

Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, economics, or business

Strong experience in FP&A, financial planning, or management reporting in a complex environment

Proven expertise in budgeting, forecasting, consolidation, and performance analysis

Strong working knowledge of SAP S/4HANA and FP&A/reporting tools




Nice-to-haves:




Professional qualification (CA, CPA, or CIMA)

Experience applying continuous improvement (LEAN) and automation in finance processes

Excellent communication and storytelling skills

Ability to influence senior stakeholders and operate effectively in a matrix environment







Why join Weir?


We live our values we think safety first, do the right thing, respect each other, aim high, and delight our customers. We encourage our people to lead by example and celebrate our successes.


We’re passionate about our purpose to help deliver the natural resources that are essential to create a better future for the world. We do this by combining our deep customer insights, world-class engineering, materials science expertise, and intelligent automation to deliver innovative end-to-end solutions incorporating our signature technologies.


We believe your voice matters and your ideas make a difference. We’re working hard to nurture a diverse culture where our people feel like they belong and can do the best work of their lives. You can help shape our unique culture through our inclusion networks and safety initiatives.







Benefits

Competitive pay

Career development and learning support

Access to global inclusion networks

Regional and team-specific benefits

Sharebuilder scheme

Wellness support for you and your family

Collaboration with global teams

Study support

A leading commercial property advisory business is seeking a Senior Analyst to support high-value retail investment transactions across Australia. Working closely with senior Partners, this role blends financial analysis, research, client engagement and marketing support ideal for someone commercially sharp who enjoys both analytical work and front-end deal exposure.

This is a career-building opportunity offering exposure to institutional-grade retail assets including shopping centres, supermarkets and large-format retail investments.

The Opportunity

You’ll play a key role supporting transaction activity, preparing investment analysis, developing marketing collateral and assisting Partners in securing new business opportunities. The role offers strong client exposure and involvement in property inspections, buyer engagement and deal support.

Key Responsibilities
Financial analysis, due diligence and cashflow modelling for retail assets
Prepare institutional-grade marketing materials and sales reporting
Research market trends, economic drivers and investment insights
Support client engagement, inspections and transaction processes
Assist Partners with business development, submissions and reporting
About You
Experience in commercial property, investment analysis or advisory
Strong financial modelling, research and analytical capability
Excellent written communication and presentation skills
Commercially minded with strong attention to detail
Proactive, curious and confident working in a fast-paced environment
What’s on Offer
Exposure to major retail investment transactions nationally
Direct mentorship from senior industry leaders
Strong career progression and development opportunity
Collaborative, high-performing team environment

For a confidential discussion please contact Caitie on 0421 827 803 OR cwoods@woodsco.com.au
